bug.short_desc: cliking on a page thumbnail should view the required page

long_desc.thetext: Open a PDF document. Nice and fast thumbnails appear in the sidebar. Clicking on one of them should take you directly to the page you just clicked on.
Andersca has a patch for this.
Just committed this

bug.short_desc: Unable to handle hyperlinks in document

long_desc.thetext:
Try to open http://www.tug.org/tex-archive/macros/latex/contrib/bytefield/example.pdf.
Evince is not able to handle whether internal on external hyperlinks on the documents, althought the bookmarks work fine.
Fixed in cvs

steps to reproduce:
select a pdf file in nautilus double click when the evince window shows but before it show the first page of it, quickly move the cursor over this window ==> Crash
this happends in my computer because it is slow enough PIII 800Mhz
If i don't move the cursor over the window and wait until evince loads the first page and then move the cursor over the window there is no crash.

duplicate submission...
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 164595 ***

Please add a dark border around the document so it is easy to distinguish the page boundaries. Thanks
Other information:

Please provide a way to keep the document centered for zoom sizes less than the height of the viewing area. At the moment the document shifts up to the top left corner. Thank you.
Other information:

It could be done by adding a (possibly optional, like in adobe's app) continuous scrolling mode. However, it can be done without continuous scrolling, but just by making the end of page a bit sticky like in xpdf.

Marking as a dup of continuos scrolling because that's what we plan.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 164597 ***

Why Shorter labels will help to avoid the toolbar menu for items that not fit
Expected behavior
Page Up -> Up Page Down -> Down Zoom In -> In Zoom Out -> Out Normal Size -> Normal Fit Page Width -> Page

Hi, thanks for the bug report.
What style of toolbars do you use?
The output of this command: gconftool-2 --get /desktop/gnome/interface/toolbar_style
Can you describe more of how the items do not fit? Horizontally, Vertically? perhaps a screenshot? I'm not sure what the problem looks like and if there is another way to fix it besides changing the text.

Of course this issue is related to "both" (and "text") toolbar style. Using "icon" and "both-horiz" the toolbar is well fitted.
Well fitted means: using default window size, all buttons appear on toolbars and the window aspect ratio is 'good'.
To reproduce launch Evince. Toolbars items from Back to Zoom In are visible. Zoom Out, Best Fit, Fit Page Width are in the "expander", due to the label length: if you want to show those items, you have to resize the window. If I'm right, currently Evince don't remember the window size, so it should be the same for all users on every system.
Using proposed shorter label, Evince toolbar will need less space to show all items, so the "expander" should appears only if you shrink a lot the window.
BTW, from HIG (chapter "Toolbars", Section "Labels and Tooltips") <quote> Most controls that appear on your toolbar will require a text label that appears on, below or beside it. Keep this description as short as possible, preferably a single verb. For example, Open or Undo. </quote>
IMHO a single work label is better if you choose the "text" style too: one word, one button.
Moreover please note that needed space to show all items in toolbar without expander could grow up when translated. For example in Italian locale we will have
Zoom In -> Aumenta ingrandimento (7 -> 21 chars) Zoom Out -> Riduci ingrandimento (8 -> 20 chars) Best Fit -> Adatta Fit Page Width -> Adatta larghezza pagina (14 -> 23 chars)
Created an attachment (id=36277) The Evince window on startup
Created an attachment (id=36278) The minimum size to show all buttons
Created an attachment (id=36279) The full button window in Italian

Considering that it's a document viewer you would be using it fullscreen most time anyway? (Things would be quite different if we keep using it as an image viewer). Not trying to ignore the problem, just to find a good compromise between space/functionality.
About the translated version, would improve things a bit:
Zoom In -> Ingrandisci Zoom Out -> Riduci
Things that we could possibly change if necessary IHMO are:
Up Down Fit Width

> About the translated version, would improve things a bit: > > Zoom In -> Ingrandisci > Zoom Out -> Riduci
Button's labels are the same of the menu entries, just the underscore is removed. This is GtKAction behavior, isn't it?
About translated version, our guidelines[1] suggest to use the "VERB ingrandimento" for menu entries . To use "Ingrandisci" and "Riduci" for menu entries will break coherence with all other applications. See the View menu nautilus, epiphany, gpdf and all other apps in it_IT.
Despite the italian transation, IMHO the issue is use a more-then-on-word label for toolbar buttons.
And cause this should come from directly form GTK+ (GtkAction, GTK_STOCK_ZOOM ...) maybe we could consider to open a bug against GTK+ too, asking to split translation of stock items for menu entries (Save as..., Zoom In, Zoom Out) and for toolbar buttons (Save as, In, Out)[3]
[1] http://www.firenze.linux.it/~algol/linee-guida/barra-dei-menu.html#menu-view
[2] Yeah, I wrote them :-)
[3] note the missing ... for toolbar

Created an attachment (id=36288) Glade comparison
A tar.gz archive with a glade file inside showing - the current toolbar - the toolbar using labels proposed from myself - same as above plus icons from gnome-icon-theme and a different Go menu
BWT please note that HIG suggests "Next/Previous Page" instead "Page Up/Down"

Hmm, I can't open the glade file for some reason. But this sounds reasonable to me. I think we can easily go with Marco's suggestions in Comment #6 of:
Up Down Fit Width
That will save some space. The others I'm not sold on yet.
I'm not inclined to follow the HIG here since next/previous is pretty similar to back/forward which we have in the toolbar. I'd rather be clearer on what the buttons do than strictly follow the HIG.
I think you have a great idea regarding the change in GTK+, you should file another bug against GTK+ about that.

attachment.desc: The minimum size to show all buttons
The full button window in Italian

bug.short_desc: Selecting text only works from top left to bottom right

long_desc.thetext: It is only possible to make a selection starting from the top right to the bottom left. If I try to select 'upwards' or to the left no selection is made.
Oops, I meant 'only works from top left to bottom right'.
Heh I rock. (For some obscure reason I knew we had this bug but I forgot about it...)

bug.short_desc: postscript documents are not centered in window

long_desc.thetext:
When viewing postscript documents with evince, they stay in the upper-left corner of the main viewing area. They should be centered in this area, like PDFs are.
This is especially obvious when using the last CVS code, which puts a nice black border around the document : if I resize the window showing a postscript document, the black border moves around to stay centered, but the document does not.
Should be fixed now.

There are a few bugs in the selection of sidebar thumbnails :
* When you launch evince, no thumbnail is selected. The first sidebar in the list should be selected. * When you switch to another page by clicking on the thumbnail, it can take some time before the page is shown, so we have no feedback showing our command worked. It would be nice to have the mouse cursor change to an hourglass or something. * When the new page appears, the page number in the toolbar is not updated.
Also, when you switch pages by using the toolbar commands, the thumbnail selection is not updated.
These should be all fixed on head. Please reopen if there is something missing...

Actually there is something weird happening :
If you select a thumbnail to go to its page, the thumbnail is selected and the mouse cursor changes to an hourglass *but* the displayed page is not changed until you get the mouse cursor out of the thumbnails area.
Once you move the mouse cursor in the main display area, the page changes.
This took me some time to discover, as it only looks like evince takes a reaaaally long time to display the page.

I dont understand your last comment... Do you mean it happen only when evince takes long time to display a page? Do you mean evince ever takes a long time when clicking on a thumbnail? Do you mean the page is actually shown after a long time?
(In general long time to display a page is due to thumbnails generation, if you wait for generation to be completed the slow down should go away, otherwise there is probably something wrong)

I could reproduce Comment 3 yesterday, now I can't. Do you still see this behavior? Is it only with certain files (I can't remember which file I was using yesterday)?
It looked as if evince was deliberately not painting the page before you moved the mouse cursor over the page.

Marco : what I mean is that it looks like evince is taking a long time to display the page. But in fact, it only displays it when you move your mouse cursor over the page, as Martin said. Martin : I'lll try to reproduce ASAP.
I cannot reproduce this behavior anymore, just like Martin. I'm marking this a fixed, please reopen if there are any more issues...

plus those missing text parts, i've got those errors on the console : Error: No display font for 'Helvetica' Error: No display font for 'Helvetica-Bold' Error: No display font for 'Helvetica-BoldOblique' Error: No display font for 'Helvetica-Oblique' Error: No display font for 'Times-Bold' Error: No display font for 'Times-BoldItalic' Error: No display font for 'Times-Italic' Error: No display font for 'Times-Roman'
for each page where this font is used, i've got that too : Error: Couldn't find a font for 'Helvetica-Bold'
Steps to reproduce:
Actual results:
Expected results:
Does this happen every time?
Other information:

<martink> LeRoutier, what does this print. fc-list "Times,Nimbus Roman No9 L,Times New Roman,Thorndale AMT,Thorndale:style=Regular,Roman:outline=true"
<LeRoutier> Nimbus Roman No9 L:style=Regular <LeRoutier> Times New Roman:style=Regular

bug.short_desc: y_offset value is bad when zoom_level != 1

long_desc.thetext:
looking at why links where not clickable most of the time in a PDF file (and a few pixels above the text in a case), i saw the following in :
pdf/xpdf/pdf-document.cc : pdf_document_get_link
i did print some debug (current x,y + x,y offsets + zoom_level)
zooming out (so y_offset > 0), it tested the following :
each time, i point the upper left document corner
zoom_level = 1/1 : y_offset == y (ok) zoom_level ~ 1/2 : y_offset ~= y/2 (bad) zoom_level ~ 1/5 : y_offset ~= y/5 (bad)
so, it looks like y_offset = y/pdf_document->scale (which should not be the case). x_offset is unaffected by zoom level
bad fix :
< link_y -= pdf_document->page_y_offset; > link_y -= ( pdf_document->page_y_offset / pdf_document->scale );
good fix : find where the y_offset is badly set and fix it (when zooming)

Created an attachment (id=36419) "zooming" should be done at the end, once y is normalized to PS/PDF coordonates
the bug was different from what i said, but it was here.
here is a fix
Thanks, in CVS now.

attachment.desc: "zooming" should be done at the end, once y is normalized to PS/PDF coordonates

bug.short_desc: highlighted area (form search) no more relevant after zoom level change

long_desc.thetext:
i did a text search, it found results then, i went to this page where there were the first results.
the text i was searching for is highlighted perfectly
now, i click on "best fit" (i change zoom level) => page redraws, the highlighted blocs are no more over the searched text.
so, it seems text highlighting as to be redone when changing zoom level

in function pdf_document_search_page_changed :
pdf_document = search->document;
highlighting is ok as long as "real" page_x_offset and page_y_offset are the same they were when the search was done.
unfortunatly, when zooming out, page_[xy]_offset could change, but not the copy which was done before the zoom change.
so, search->document->page_[xy]_offset aren't updated, and position of highlight blocks are bad

Created an attachment (id=36421) hope it fixes it well
please test and apply
Committed. Thanks.

bug.short_desc: Evince makes a mess of the following document :

long_desc.thetext:
ftp://ftp10.dlink.com/pdfs/products/DGS-1024D/DGS-1024D_ds.pdf
acroread works ggv works xpdf fails like evince gpdf fails like evince
evince-0.1.0-0.20050120 on Fedora Core Devel (Raw Hide)
Looks very close to bug 164754. The rendering artifacts are the same.
I can reproduce
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 164754 ***

This two PDF documents do not render properly :
http://matias.ca/tactilepro/resources/TactilePro_Infosheet.pdf http://www.davidco.com/pdfs/gtd_workflow_advanced.pdf
Letters and graphs are missing. The render in evince look kinda the same for both, so I figured it could be the same bug happening.
Does they work in gpdf?

Created an attachment (id=36329) testfile tactilepro.pdf opened in gpdf (2.8.1) and evince (cvs head)
Window on the left is gpdf, on the right is evince. It seems evince does a better job rendering a image(?) in the PDF.
On both test cases evince does a better job at the rendering than gpdf on my PC.

Created an attachment (id=36339) screenshot of evince showing the infosheet pdf
Well your evince works better than mine :) Here is a screenshot showing how the tactilepro.pdf file shows up on my computer. Notice how the text is all garbled - you cannot tell what it is about.
Marco : the same thing happens to me using gpdf. xpdf and xpdf/cairo just exit, while xpdf-3 shows no text at all, only the images. acroread (v. 5.05 or something) has no problem.

Very strange. My evince and gpdf behave as in Hein-Jan's screenshot.
Is there anything special about your freetype2 installation? Which version is it? Did it change recently?
What's the difference between xpdf and xpdf-3?

Martin : I plead guilty, I was using a devel version of freetype (pkgconfig shows 9.8.3). I downgraded to freetype 2.1.9 (pkgconfig showing 9.7.3), but it looks the same. No change. Should I downgrade more ? ;-)
The difference between xpdf and xpdf-3 is mainly the version number :) I noticed that the two versions sometimes render pdfs differently.

I'm afraid that my evince and gpdf (lastest stable versions both) behave as Vincent shows. Both files contain CID fonts (which I thought I read they were not displayed by gpdf).
I don't know what you guys (Martin and Hein-Jan) are doing, but I would like to know how to get it on my computer ;-).
BTW xpdf display the same font and character mess that evince and gpdf show.

Vincent: I discovered that Ubuntu is still at 2.1.7. I will try 2.1.9 and see if that breaks evince for me.
Pablo: what about your freetype version?
I'm asking these freetype questions because you reported that all of xpdf, evince, and gpdf have this problem. It may be totally unrelated to freetype, but I don't know what else might be causing this.
Martin, I use FreeType 2.1.9, but I have just discovered that ggv opens both documents right.
Pablo : ggv is not working for me neither :(
Bug 165166 looks very similar.
*** Bug 165166 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 164767 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

After updating freetype from 2.1.7 to 2.1.9 I can reproduce this problem.
Pablo: ggv doesn't use freetype.

This freetype patch might help.
http://thread.gmane.org/gmane.comp.fonts.freetype.devel/2199
I can't test now. If it works, this would be NOTGNOME. Any objections?
The objection being, it does not work (unless I've borked my patching)
It doesn't work for Marco either (and I found a mail that says that the patch is indeed not the solution for this problem). Sorry.
Fixed in cvs
This totally rocks. Thank you !

bug.short_desc: Opening an image file (png or jpg at least) with evince

long_desc.thetext:
Distribution: Debian 3.1 Package: evince Severity: normal Version: 0.1.x Synopsis: Opening an image file (png or jpg at least) with evince Bugzilla-Product: evince Bugzilla-Component: general Bugzilla-Version: 0.1.x BugBuddy-GnomeVersion: 2.0 (2.8.0) Description: Description of the crash: As it attempts to open, it crashes immediately
Steps to reproduce the crash: 1. Open evince, go to file open 2. At the bottom, above cancel and open select file type images 3. Browse to a png or jpg and try to open it
Expected Results: Either open the image or print an error that doesn't crash the program
How often does this happen? Every time I tried it (4 or 5 tries)
Additional Information:

*** Bug 164853 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

This commit has fixed it, I guess.
2005-01-21 Martin Kretzschmar <martink@gnome.org>
* pixbuf/pixbuf-document.c (pixbuf_document_get_n_pages) (pixbuf_document_get_text, pixbuf_document_document_iface_init): stub out missing methods for complete EvDocument implementation. Fixes segfaults with Save A Copy and Copy actions.

bug.short_desc: find previous and find next don't work

long_desc.thetext: If I try to find a word in a multipage document, it finds the occurrences, but if I press Next or Previous, nothing happens (only in the console Find Previous or Find Next is printed).

Created an attachment (id=36397) Implementation which jumps between pages with search results
Implementation of 'Find Previous' and 'Find Next' as jumping between pages with search results. This patch needs to be extended to jump (and "focus") to results on the current page.

Thanks, Jan, for the bugfix.
I'm afraid that it wasn't added in the lastest 0.1.1 release.
Shouldn't be this bugfix merged in mainstream or am I missing something?
I'm not sure if this should cycle between pages. Maybe we should have a different color for the current selection and cycle through selections instead? (That's how firefox does it).

I think a different color for the current selection and the other results is a good idea.
We should probably jump to the next available pages when people cycle through next. Otherwise you have to manually move to the next page.
JRB also had something for putting the highlighted results on the page thumbnails as well. Just something to consider.

fixed in cvs
If there are problems, please post separate bugs.

attachment.desc: Implementation which jumps between pages with search results

long_desc.thetext:
I find it quite a pain that I have to use page down to go down the page and Ctrl+PageDown to change to the next page. I would prefer to only use pagedown, to scroll trough a document. Preferably that if you look at the end of page 1 you already see the beginning of page 2.(like acrobat reader)
Or maybe if it is much easier that page down at the end of the page just changes to the next page.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 164597 ***

bug.short_desc: Up and Down buttons are mislabeled.

long_desc.thetext:
The bottons are effectively Page Down (labeled 'Down') and Page Up (labeled 'Up'). The 'Down' button has an up arrow icon, and the 'Up' button has a down arrow icon. The labels are backwards.
The 'Down' button is to the left of the 'Up' botton. This positioning seems backwards.
this is fixed in cvs

bug.short_desc: scroll to top when switching page

long_desc.thetext:
Please implement automatic scrolling to the to of a page when it is switched. A case where this is useful is when reading a long document/book.
Thanks for all of your good work. Evince has definitely become my document viewer of choice.
Other information:
Yes, when you hit page down from a previous page it should start at the top of the next page. Doesn't it do that now? I guess I should test this.
fixed in cvs

bug.short_desc: cursor flickers a lot while moving

long_desc.thetext: this did not happend in gpdf or ggv
I see that too. The cursor flickrs a lot if you move it slowly over a pdf or postscript document.
This is probably fixed in cvs, please reopen if you can still reproduce.
Yep, fixed.

I do pdf presentations and I need to have a fullscreen switch somewhere so that only my pdf shows (no menu, no "exit fullscreen mode" button...).
I would be delighted if you could add that to evince.

There is now a fullscreen mode in evince - you can disable the toolbar and sidebar, then switch to fullscreen mode, and the only element that appears is the "exit fullscreen mode" button.
You specify that you "need to have a fullscreen switch somewhere". Indeed, where do you put this switch if only your pdf shows ?

There is also a plan to auto-hide the toolbar / exit fullscreen switch. See bug #164776.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 164776 ***

bug.short_desc: evince should keep the 'best fit' and 'fit width' settings while going fullscreen

long_desc.thetext:
Idealy, when 'best fit' is chosen, the document should remain 'best fit' after resizing the screen.
When the toolbar is deselected and in fullscreen, it is impossible to choose 'best fit'.
I suggest either evince provides a shortcut for 'best fit' and 'fit width' or it remembers 'best fit' and 'fit width' at least while going fullscreen.
Other information:
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 165471 ***

bug.short_desc: Thumbnail list should always show current slide

long_desc.thetext: When paging through a document using PgUp and PgDn, the thumbnail list should scroll to keep the currently-highlighted thumbnail in view.
This one is easy, patches welcome ;)
There is a commit by Martin about this, should be fixed in cvs

bug.short_desc: Fullscreen key should not be forced to F11

long_desc.thetext:
This key can be redefined (at least in metacity). evince should idealy recognise the keybinding and not use F11 if it has been changed. What happens if F11 has been binded to "kill window"?
Other information:
That's a general problem with any accellerator of any GNOME application. Unless I'm missing what you mean exactly, this doesnt look like an evince issue.

bug.short_desc: Evince does not support eps documents

long_desc.thetext:
Distribution: Debian 3.1 Package: evince Severity: normal Version: GNOME2.8.1 0.1.x Gnome-Distributor: Debian Synopsis: Evince does not support eps documents Bugzilla-Product: evince Bugzilla-Component: general Bugzilla-Version: 0.1.x Description: Description of Problem: Evince cannot open EPS documents
Steps to reproduce the problem: 1. Run evince with an EPS document as argument, or use File/Open to select one
Actual Results: Evince reports "unhandled mime-type 'image/x-eps'"
Expected Results: Evince opens the eps
How often does this happen?: Every time
Additional Information: Both gv and ggv successfully open eps document with no problems.
------- Bug moved to this database by unknown@bugzilla.gnome.org 2005-02-01 06:11 -------
Unknown platform unknown. Setting to default platform "Other". Unknown milestone "unknown" in product "evince". Setting to default milestone for this product, '---' Setting to default status "UNCONFIRMED". Setting qa contact to the default for this product. This bug either had no qa contact or an invalid one.

As it wasn't fixed on the current Gnome anon CVS, and there wasn't any information on *where* it was fixed, I have reopened this bug. I've just double-checked on the viewcvs interface, and there is a changelog entry which says it's fixed. However, I would have appreciated being told where it was fixed. Will reclose once the anon cvs tree catches up and I am able to run my test document past evince again.

Distribution: Fedora Core release Rawhide (Rawhide) Package: evince Severity: normal Version: GNOME2.9.90 CVS HEAD Gnome-Distributor: GNOME.Org Synopsis: crash during find Bugzilla-Product: evince Bugzilla-Component: general Bugzilla-Version: CVS HEAD BugBuddy-GnomeVersion: 2.0 (2.9.1) Description: Steps to reproduce the crash: 1. Open Document, Ctrl-F 2. enter in text that exists in the page, but continue entering text until there is no match 3. Crash
How often does this happen? Everytime

bug.short_desc: Crash on search in CVS version

long_desc.thetext: Build from CVS 20050203 1200z. Open attached pdf file. Type Ctrl+f ht (never got to 'tp') Segfault
Created an attachment (id=36913) Backtrace from segfault
Created an attachment (id=36914) Document where the crash occurred
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 165959 ***

bug.short_desc: Evince crashed while searching in a PDF

long_desc.thetext:
I opened a PDF and tried to look for a string inside it. Nothing happened so I clicked on "next" a few times. Evince was working extremely slowly, and eventually crashed.
Backtrace was generated from '/usr/bin/evince'

bug.short_desc: evince crashes when hitting PAGE_DOWN on last page

long_desc.thetext:
1. Open a Document (I think it should have more than 2 pages) 2. Go to the last page 3. Press Page_Down
Result: evince crashes
evince should check if we are on the last page, and then don't go to the unexisting next one.

Created an attachment (id=36870) a simple patch
This should fix it. Maybe someone could clean it up a little more.
fixed in cvs
For a postscript document viewer it can be expected that it handles gzipped ps. Evince doesn't understand this format, GGV has no problems with it.
Can you provide a testcase please?

Created an attachment (id=36866) testcase
Sure, here is one.
fixed in cvs

bug.short_desc: crashes when opening unstructured ps document

long_desc.thetext:
Try to open the attached ps file.
I get the following warning:
(evince:19019): GLib-GObject-WARNING **: gsignal.c:1716: signal `found' is invalid for instance `0x8408f58'
And it seems that evince finds more than two billions of pages where there is only one.

Created an attachment (id=35720) Postcript file (only one file)
Sorry, I forgot the attachment.
The 'found' thing is already fixed in cvs.
If the bug is already fixed, this report could be closed, couldn't it?

>And it seems that evince finds more than two billions of pages where there is >only one.
What do you mean exactly?

I don't have the CVS version installed (and Martin reports that the error was fixed [at least partially]), but if I open the attached file with evince, the first page is page 1 of 2147483647 pages (two thousand millions in Europe).
If the bug is already fixed, this report should be closed.
We should probably make page navigator insensitive in this case and set it to 0/0 or something.
the bug is not fixed in the CVS. gnome-gv displays the same file fine

All I was saying was: It does no longer print
(evince:19019): GLib-GObject-WARNING **: gsignal.c:1716: signal `found' is invalid for instance `0x8408f58'
in CVS. However, as this is unrelated to the actual bug, it's not a particularly interesting fact ;-)
fixed in cvs

Sorry, I hadn't realized that version 0.1.3 had been already released (and this is already fixed).
By the way, evince still shows billions of pages where there is only one (see screenshot.png) and it isn't able to display the the attached Postscript document.
Created an attachment (id=37005) image with number of pages
Sorry again, evince displays fine the file I talked about in the last post.
Fixed the page number issue in cvs

"Exit Fullscreen" should be "Leave Fullscreen" as per HIG, should be in the top-right corner instead of bottom-left where it obscurs the thumbnail sidebar, and use the new stock_leave-fullscreen stock icon from g-i-t instead of GTK_STOCK_QUIT.
If you agree, I'm going to provide a patch.
Sounds good, I'm unsure about the position though... ccing Bryan

Ok, the stock icon update sounds good.
I'm hesitant about the positioning since two apps that I like and use very much (Epiphany and Totem) both have the 'Exit Fullscreen' on the bottom left. Everything in the guildeline sounds good, however the positioning seems bad, or maybe just not as important as having most apps use the same place. Maybe I should get a hold of Calum and figure out if we really wanted it on the top right and not the bottom left.
In Epiphany we've just changed it to top-right (from bug 153270), since that's what the HIG says...

Ok, I didn't get a hold of Calum, but I checked out the new Epiphany (good work!) and it looks reasonable to put the 'Leave Fullscreen' button in the upper right as part of the toolbar.
I suppose we'll run into the same autohide issues. PDF and PS viewers are very often used for presentations so we should think about making the autohide functionality work well too. Thanks!
This is waiting for patches from the awesome chpe :-)
*** Bug 165794 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Created an attachment (id=37038) fix
This patch does (all the same as Epiphany): - change "Exit Fullscreen" to "Leave Fullscreen" - use the new stock_leave-fullscreen icon from g-i-t - move the popup to top right corner - if toolbar=on, show a "Leave Fullscreen" item in the toolbar to the right, instead of showing the popup - on focus in/out, show/hide the popup as to not show up on other workspaces too
It also fixes a bug I noticed while working on this: toggle toolbar off, sidebar on, go fullscreen and activate the sidebar's combo box -> surprise! :)

/* Toolbar icons */ #define EV_STOCK_ZOOM_FIT_WIDTH "ev-zoom-fit-width"
+#define EV_STOCK_LEAVE_FULLSCREEN "stock_leave-fullscreen"
no space between the defines please. I'm totally sure you missed my nitpicks a lot :P
+ /* This sucks, but there is no way to have a draw=no, expand=true separator + * in a GtkUIManager-built toolbar. So, just add another toolbar. + */
Did you post a bug about this? It should probably be referenced there.
How much would it take to persist chrome in prefs like in epiphany?

Created an attachment (id=37073) updated patch
>/* Toolbar icons */ > #define EV_STOCK_ZOOM_FIT_WIDTH "ev-zoom-fit-width" > >+#define EV_STOCK_LEAVE_FULLSCREEN "stock_leave-fullscreen"
>no space between the defines please. Fixed.
>+ /* This sucks, but there is no way to have a draw=no, expand=true separator >+ * in a GtkUIManager-built toolbar. So, just add another toolbar. >+ */ >Did you post a bug about this? It should probably be referenced there. Filed, it's gtk+ bug 166489.
>How much would it take to persist chrome in prefs like in epiphany? Implemented in the updated patch: I now persist the toolbar, statusbar and sidebar toggles to gconf, and read them on startup from there. Schemas file added too.

(From update of attachment 37073) + <key>/schemas/apps/evince/show_toolbar_bar</key> + <applyto>/apps/evince/show_toolbar/applyto>
Looks like you have a wrong _bar suffix in all keys there.
Please commit with this fixed, thanks!

(From update of attachment 37073) I just updated the schema file and commited to fix this error:
- <applyto>/apps/evince/show_toolbar/applyto> + <applyto>/apps/evince/show_toolbar</applyto>
- <applyto>/apps/evince/show_sidebar/applyto> + <applyto>/apps/evince/show_sidebar</applyto> - <applyto>/apps/evince/show_statusbar/applyto> + <applyto>/apps/evince/show_statusbar</applyto>
Seems like this has all landed in CVS, closing. I guess reopen it if I'm mistaken.

Open evince (in Debian), open a document, press F11 (fullscreen) and then press Escape. Fullscreen mode doesn't close (IMO it should, but that's a judgement call, I suppose).
Still in fullscreen mode, press "Play/Pause" or "Next" or "Previous" on your multimedia keyboard. Evince leaves fullscreen mode.
Yep, HIG defines escape to be a key that exits fullscreen. This has landed in CVS HEAD now, not sure about the multimedia keys though. Can you try with the latest version and let us know.
Christian fixed the multimedia keys as part his patch in bug #164776.

bug.short_desc: Evince doesn't use a window icon

long_desc.thetext: Patch coming up
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 166177 ***

Created an attachment (id=37206) One liner
Just like in .desktop file of evince it uses the postscript-viewer. Should updated when evince gets it's own document viewer icon.
BTW Cool program
Oops, collision, sorry about that :) You were too fast !
I'm sorry for not checking if the bug was already filed. Usually do that but this time I forgot :-(
Please check it in. Thanks!
It's in. Thanks !
Evince's window does not accept DnD of files from Nautilus etc. to open them.
Not too difficult to add, any patches for this?

Created an attachment (id=36886) Patch that adds support for DnD of files
Ok to commit? :-)
Ccing the patch submitter

Created an attachment (id=37259) An updated patch
Marco, sorry for the delay, I'm very busy these days because of the uni exams ...

> Is this really needed? If I'm not mistake this will be called by gtk on some > other events. data_received doesnt sounds like the right signal to finish the > drago to me.
I'm not sure at all, but the gtk documentation says that it's used to inform the source that the drop is finished. I saw it in the example of the drag-data-received signal (http://developer.gnome.org/doc/API/2.0/gtk/GtkWidget.html#GtkWidget-drag-data-received)
Yeah reading the docs that looks correct. (Weird I've never seen it in any code so far). When you fixed the two other nitpicks please commit the patch. Thanks!
Looks like the fix was checked in. Thanks!

attachment.desc: Patch that adds support for DnD of files

long_desc.thetext:
Version details: 0.1.1 Distribution/Version: Debian/experimental
Icon for page up says 'Down' and vice versa. But maybe I just drink too much tea.
This has been fixed in more recent evince. Please upgrade to 0.1.4 or CVS.

File: shell/ev-window.c String: "Reset the zoom level to the defaul value"
Missing "t" from "default"
I'm fixing up the TODO list, so I can do this one as well.
Fixed in CVS.

I have a large pdf ~130 pages, and if I scroll the thumbnail view immediately after it is opened, evince appears to fail to thumbnail all pages. What appears to happen is:
1) It starts off thumbnailing the first few pages 2) I scroll to the end of the pdf, and it thumbnails those visible pages (which is nice) 3) It then seems to fail to thumbnail the remaining pages fully (it does some, not others)
It doesn't seem totally reproducable which pages it thumbnails, and which it leaves blank.
(this is with 0.1.3-0ubuntu1)

I had a quick look at this:
in ev-sidebar-thumbnails.c:do_one_iteration I added "g_print( "Thumbnailing %d\n", priv->current_page);" inside the if (!thumbnail_set), and got:
Thumbnailing 0 <ditto for 1-17> Thumbnailing 18 Thumbnailing 91 Thumbnailing 108 Thumbnailing 115 Thumbnailing 121 Thumbnailing 121 Thumbnailing 123 Thumbnailing 124 Thumbnailing 126 Thumbnailing 127 Thumbnailing 128 Thumbnailing 129 Thumbnailing 130 Thumbnailing 0 Thumbnailing 1 Thumbnailing 2 Thumbnailing 3 Thumbnailing 4 Thumbnailing 5 Thumbnailing 126 Thumbnailing 127 Thumbnailing 128 Thumbnailing 129 Thumbnailing 130 Thumbnailing 0 Thumbnailing 1 Thumbnailing 2 <ditto up to 90>
Obviously there is some incorrect counting somewhere, as the thumbnails for some pages seem to be re done, meaning that the pages_done flag gets out of sync with the real world.

Created an attachment (id=37412) Patch
The problem is that the COLUMN_THUMBNAIL_SET value is never set in the tree model, so the thumbnail could be generated multiple times for individual pages.
(From update of attachment 37412) I dont know that code much but it looks sane. Please commit assuming you tested it carefully!

Fixed in CVS:
http://mail.gnome.org/archives/cvs-commits-list/2005-February/msg03982.html

bug.short_desc: 'Best Fit' and 'Fit width' algorythms need tuning

long_desc.thetext:
purpose of 'Best Fit' and 'Fit Width' is to make either : - the horizontal scrollbar go away (Fit Width) - both scroolbars go away (Best Fit)
actually, it is the case for neither of those (even if it is close)
more than that, clicking 2 times on BestFit or FitWidth buttons would give different results (2nd try beeing better than first try).
Best Fit :
first time i press it, there is a 3/4 mm margin on top and bottom of document and no scroolbar second time i press it, no more margin, vertical scrollbar is back
Fit Width :
first time i press it, there is still a horizontal scrollbar second time i press it, the h scrollbar is still here, but shorter.

ok, problem is : shell/ev-view.c : ev_view_fit_width/ev_view_best_fit
GTK_WIDGET (view)->allocation.width/height report width/height available in current widget.
the problem is that if content is too big to fit, it reports 18px less (to put the scrollbar)
so, unless we find a way to test for scrollbar presence, we're f....d

Created an attachment (id=36429) ugly fix for this bug
i say it is ugly because of the '18' in code. it seems to be the size of a scrollbar (on my system at least)
but as pointed by martin, it could perhaps be theme dependant
so, lets say it is a work-around for now
Created an attachment (id=36430) same patch, but not backward this time

What about just using the scrolledwindow->allocation? That should deal with the scrollbar size. We could just move the two functions in ev-window, so that we can have access to the scrolled window without hacks (I think they can be private as they are only used in ev-window).

i didn't use it because i simply don't know it existed :)
i'll come back to the chan in about 6 hours (no time before) and i'll try to cook a better patch that follow those guidelines
Stephane any news on this?
(From update of attachment 36430) Just updating the status of this patch.
I have rewritten the patch following Marco's suggestions.
And it's in CVS HEAD now.

attachment.desc: same patch, but not backward this time

long_desc.thetext: Open a PDF with a multi-line title (it should be quite easy to find in scientific papers) - evince will use it as the window title, with hilarious consequences for metacity, the window list and window selector applets, etc.
Created an attachment (id=36900) screenshot showing a multi-line title
Hmm, I guess we should use Pango elipsis to shorten the titles to a size smaller than the window size.

Bryan, this was about files that had an explicit newline in their title, not files where the title was somehow wrapped because it was too long.
In CVS newlines are removed from the window title now.
The Evince window has no icon set. I know there is another bug to use a thumbnail of the opened document as an icon, but there should be an icon even when no document is opened.
We should probably add document-viewer in icon theme. Bryan does current desktop icon work? Or should we get something better?
Agreed. We should probably ask for an icon in icon theme. The current psviewer icon should be fine for now though.
*** Bug 166714 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
I just added a patch in bug 166714. Vicent was so blazingly fast resolving it as a duplicate, such that I missed the duplicate mail.
ping : is the proposed patch ok ?
Created an attachment (id=37552) As a convenience I also attach the patch here
(From update of attachment 37552) Sorry I missed this. Looks good, just please use tab instead of spaces.
Jaap : can you commit ?

Created an attachment (id=37562) Now using tabs
Don't have commit access, can somebody else commit?
it's in. Thanks a lot !

attachment.desc: As a convenience I also attach the patch here

long_desc.thetext: I'm attaching this patch I've shamelessly stolen from the mighty Kristian Høgsberg and his work on Evince for the xdevcon presentation.

Created an attachment (id=37546) fullscreen autohide patch
Posting this for review

Should fullscreen auto-hide hide the toolbar instead of just showing/hiding the Leave Fullscreen popup? Hiding/showing the toolbar on mouse move interacts badly with fit-to sizing (move the mouse -> show toolbar -> the document view resizes).

Yes, but it allows mouse navigation at fullscreen mode. The fit-to sizing should return to normal when the toolbar leaves so it just gives a weird squish look for a little while. I guess ideally I'd rather the whole toolbar just popup over the document instead of squishing it. I don't know if that's possible, this was a patch from me and I was just hacking at other peoples stuff ;-)
The patch is in, with minor tweaks. If there are issues please file separate bugs. Thanks ;)
File->Print calls up the libgnomeprint dialog, so the menu item should have an ellipsis appended.
Yep, it looks like we're using GTK_STOCK_PRINT here, which I think is why we aren't getting the ellipsis. I guess we just need to add our own label there. I can do that.
Fixed in CVS HEAD
I'd like to have a tool like the "hand tool" of acrobat reader (or gpdf).

Thanks for the request. I'm folding this one into the "Modes" request since they are asking for the same thing in the 3rd mode.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 165155 ***

EOG has a convenient way of implementing zoom-to-fit. When an image is zoomed-to-fit, resizing the EOG window will resize the image to fit again. It is only when the user explicitly changes the zoom factor that it becomes "detached" from the window.
*** Bug 165904 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

ggv has an option in preferences to fit with or fit height when resizing windows.
I don't know whether this is actually HIG compilant, but it is a nice way to improve it.
I made best-fit and fit-to-width sticky.

bug.short_desc: Some pdf-Files are renamed to doc-Files in the title-bar when opening

long_desc.thetext:
Maybe this has something to do with the fact that they were written with Microsoft Word (or something like this), but it's quite confusing to see a wrong filename in the title.
Other information:
That's the title that Word put into the pdf file. It is confusing, but I think you can change it when you create the pdf.

Distribution/Version: mandrake cooker
The aims04.ps file (attached) fails to display in evince. It displays correctly in gv, and evince can display it when it's converted to pdf.
The console shows this warning:
(evince:9010): Gdk-WARNING **: ../../../gdk/x11/gdkdrawable-x11.c:972 drawable is not a pixmap or window
Created an attachment (id=37593) problematic ps file
Works for me with cvs. Closing because ps support in cvs is improved a lot. If you are still able to reproduce it please reopen.

Continued from bug 167612 comment 3: > I guess ideally I'd rather the whole toolbar just > popup over the document instead of squishing it.
I have a patch implementing this.
Created an attachment (id=37565) implementation
(From update of attachment 37565) this patch is slightly buggy, new patch coming up in a bit

Created an attachment (id=37569) updated patch
This also hides the popup when the window loses focus (so you don't end up with the toolbar popup when switching to other workspaces). There's one remaining problem: you can't input in the page selector (arrow work, though); but I suspect this is a gtk+ bug caused by the reparenting.
Whoops - I totally missed this patch and wrote my own, and committed something to do this. I didn't notice the entry not working, though as I'm not reparenting it's not that. Sorry!

In order to be able use evince without touching the mouse it would be nice to have keybindings for zooming. I would expect either + and - or ctr-+ and ctrl-- to work.
Other information:
well, they do (Ctrl+ and Ctrl-). At least on my box. Do zoom keybindings work in e.g. epiphany ?

No they don't work in epiphany either (version 1.4.7), but they do in dia (and firefox - but that isn't gtk).
Does this mean that it is a problem with a gtk/gnome widget ? I don't use the full gnome desktop environment (xfce instead) not sure if that influences applications like epiphany. My gtk version is 2.6.1
What is your keyboard setup ? US, or something else ?

Yep default "us" qwerty and I don't use any localization or keymap configs.
As it appears now ctrl+ and ctrl- do work when I use the '+' and '-' that are between the 0 and the backspace. But they don't work using the '+' and '-' at the numpad.
Same thing with epiphany, so this bug/problem probably isn't evince specific. Notice that in for example dia both '+' keys do exactly the same.
Would be nice though to be able to use the numpad keys for this - For the '+' this is a bit easier not having to use the shift key. - It confused me, so it will probably confuse other people.

Ok. There are discussions about implementing this (zoom with numeric keypad) directly into gtk+ - see bug 105183 which was filed against epiphany. Integrating the functionality directly in gtk+ would solve the problem once and for all apps.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 105183 ***
Try selecting some text in this PDF : http://www.irs.gov/pub/irs-pdf/i1040nr.pdf Copy and paste it : you get a part of the text, but hard to tell which one.
Vincent: it's working for me, I'm getting the right text copied. Are you talking about the text selection mode, like in bug 165155 ?

Yes. Let's say I select the first paragraph after "What's new for 2004", copy it, and paste it : I get random part of the page. Actually, with CVS when I paste I get nothing (ie the clipboard is empty)
If I select "Select All" in the Edit menu, I get a little square selection box in the upper-left corner of the document area - so there's definitely something weird going on here.

After zooming, if evince is fullscreen and the document is centered, and I try "select all", the selection box fills the upper-left corner of the document area. It looks like it does not follow the document around (like in bug 167629).
Fixed in cvs

bug.short_desc: selection box does not follow zoom or window size

long_desc.thetext: Select a part of a document (I've tried with PDF, but others might work). Then zoom or unzoom, or even resize the window. The selection box does not move. I guess it would be best if the selection box followed the selected area, or, if this is not doable, just clear the selection box on zoom/resize.
This may or may not be related to bug #167628 (wrong text in selection).
fixed in cvs

Yep, confirmed, I can reproduce. Easy fun.
Fixed in cvs

Download http://www.heko.dk/~maj/a/solweek1.ps
and type evince solweek1.ps
Now change to page 2, and the arrow will become the hourglass and never return.
This should be fixed in cvs / 0.1.4 If it's not please reopen
I was able to make evince hand with this postscript, but for me it happens when trying to get to page 5.
I meant "hang" and not "hand". :P

with export EV_LOG_MODULES=all, when I try to switch to page 5 I get :
[ ps-document.c ] Go to page 5 [ ps-document.c ] It's a structured document, let's send one page to gs
and then it hangs. When opening the document, I get :
[ ps-document.c ] Load the document [ ps-document.c ] Setup the page [ ps-document.c ] Set the page size [ ps-document.c ] Setup the page [ ps-document.c ] Go to page -2
The "-2" looks weird to me, but what do I know about postscript ?

It seams that this bug occures on every last page of this type of PS files.
Here is a 7 page ps file, and it freezes only on the last page. just like the 5 page version.
http://www.heko.dk/~maj/a/solweek2.ps

Here's another document with the same problem: http://www.stud.uni-karlsruhe.de/~udatk/ti/klausuren/k_ss_00.ps Actually, this happened with every single ps file I tried. It seems like evince shifts the page numbers by 1 on these documents: The number in the little page number chooser is always 1 too low, except on the first page (The document I linked to has page numbers making this pretty obvious). On page 2, the back button is disabled and on the last page, the forward button is enabled. I guess when you click the forward button on the last page, evince tries to display a page that doesn't exist (eg, page 6 in the 5-page document) and hangs.
GGV displays these documents fine, btw.
Should be fixed in cvs. If someone has time to test switching ps pages well, that would be appreciated.

While investigating why a particular pdf (http://www.cambridgeshire.gov.uk/NR/rdonlyres/81FC1BA6-A01B-4E49-9353-FBACC13F4635/0/grit_cambridge.pdf) takes a long time to display in evince, I found that each page is rendered twice.
If I instrument pdf-document.cc, I get the following:
------- $ EV_LOG_MODULES=pdf-document.cc ./shell/evince /tmp/grit_cambridge.pdf [ pdf-document.cc ] pdf_document_load (0x82ffb40) [ pdf-document.cc ] pdf_document_get_page_size (0x82ffb40, -1) [ pdf-document.cc ] pdf_validate_page (0x82ffb40) = calling DisplayPage
[ pdf-document.cc ] pdf_document_get_page_size (0x82ffb40, -1) [ pdf-document.cc ] pdf_document_get_page_size (0x82ffb40, -1) [ pdf-document.cc ] pdf_document_set_scale (0x82ffb40, 0.570071) [ pdf-document.cc ] page_valid = FALSE [ pdf-document.cc ] pdf_document_get_page_size (0x82ffb40, -1) [ pdf-document.cc ] pdf_validate_page (0x82ffb40) = calling DisplayPage
[ pdf-document.cc ] pdf_document_get_page_size (0x82ffb40, -1) [ pdf-document.cc ] pdf_document_get_page_size (0x82ffb40, -1) [ pdf-document.cc ] pdf_document_get_page_size (0x82ffb40, -1) [ pdf-document.cc ] pdf_document_render (0x82ffb40, 0, 0, 461, 505) ------
The gaps in the output are where the rendering actually takes place. The page is only displayed on screen when the document_render() function finishes.
(Note that this causes the above pdf to take about 7 seconds to display (as opposed to the 3 it would otherwise.)

It would be nice if get_page_size didn't use pdf_validate_page and then query the rendered bitmap for its size.
Instead it could pdf_document->doc->getPageWidth(page), scale the result and maybe round it. Would this break anything?

Created an attachment (id=37755) Patch
The getWidth() and getHeight() functions in the Page object do seem to work just fine. They are computed from the box sizes which are worked out when the pdf is loaded.
This patch does change the sematics of the function, but previously they looked broken, in that if you called it with page == -1 the size returned was scaled, but if you called it with page != -1 the value wasn't scaled. This makes it always return scaled values.
I looked through the uses of get_page_size() and all call it with page == -1 with the exception of ev_page_view which isn't hooked up yet, and always calls it with scale = 1.0 anyway.
I have tested a few pdfs and can't see any breakages.
This looks pretty right. I went ahead and committed it.

bug.short_desc: "Fit Width" button still leaves a horizontal scrollbar

long_desc.thetext:
Please describe the problem: when opening a pdf file and then selecting "Fit Width" command, the evince viewer still has a horizontal scrollbar at the bottom of the screen. it should not.
Steps to reproduce: 1. open a pdf file 2. click on "Fit Width" button
Actual results: see a horizontal scrollbar at the bottom of the screen
Expected results: no horizontal scrollbar
Does this happen every time? yes
Other information:
This is already fixed in cvs

With evince CVS, the 'best fit' option is always turned on at startup (as reported in bug 167602). If you deselect 'best fit', by clicking on the toolbar button, and resize the window, the document still resizes to follow the window size. So the 'best fit' option is not actually turned off. If you zoom in/out, the option is reset and the document stops resizing on window resize.

Earlier today on irc (time is CET)
Feb 16 12:19:46 jrb I just realized that you can unclick the toggle buttons; whoops
We don't want to make them radio buttons, so we will have to catch toggle up and retoggle it. We will probably have to guard against loops here.

Is there any real need to make best fit be a toggle button? I.e. does it makes sense to tell the user that he *is* in auto-fit mode? EOG does pretty nicely without this; the buttons are always un-pressed.
I don't think it's absolutely necessary for them to be toggle buttons, but the more feedback the better.
Fixed in cvs

The drag-to-copy support in Evince is an awesome start, but suffers from some accuracy problems. On almost every document I've tried (all being of moderate layout complexity) the text that was visually highlighted after the rubber-band operation was not the same as the text that was pasted in another application when the middle-button was clicked. Usually it's just the beginning and/or end of the text that gets cut, nothing in the middle is lost.

Right now selecting the right text is more of an art form than anything ;-) We're going to go away from using the current selection tool for copying text and moving towards something like a real text selector and a real image section selector as in bug 165155
I guess this should be left open as a known bug and when we get moved over to a real text tool we can close this.
I think this bug has been fixed in cvs (even if we dont have real text selection yet).

Created an attachment (id=37892) PDF file
Meant to say, it works fine in xpdf.

Looks like a dup.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 166602 ***
Open evince. The sidebar is opened by default. Close the sidebar and quit evince. The next time you open evince, the sidebar should be closed, but this setting is never remembered.
Renaming so that it also apply to statusbar and toolbar. Size of the sidebar should be remembered too.
Just to let you know guys - evince is already far more usable than gpdf for most tasks, and I'm using it as my main pdf viewer. Congratulations for an awesome piece of work.

I don't know what should be done with other documents, but Adobe has released a document with the tile "PDF Open Parameters" (http://partners.adobe.com/public/developer/en/acrobat/PDFOpenParams.pdf), that specify how PDF files should be opened and how should be displayed after an hyperlink is followed.
This is the kind of setting that should be remembered for the application lifetime, however just noting that bug 164772 talks about window properties that are for the document lifetime.
We just need to remember sidebar visibility/position now. Patches welcome ;)

I had missed the commit, but the sidebar visibility is actually remembered now...
2005-02-07 Christian Persch <chpe@cvs.gnome.org>
Implement fullscreen mode changes from bug #164776. Also implement persistent chrome toggles.
Visibility is done, I'm renaming this to be about sidebar size. Perhaps this should be closed eventually to follow bug 166683 about the new sidebar widget.

Created an attachment (id=37848) A patch for sidebar size persiting
This patch also fixes an issue of the previous patch (#166683). I've only moved the connection of the sidebar visibility signal after the creation of the other
widgets. It avoids calling to gtk_widget_show for widgets not created yet.

I think we should just set the size in gconf every time is changed, instead of storing it in the window structure. That way new windows will get the current sidebar size and not the one of the last closed window.
I finished this and checked in because I want it in the release... Thanks!

attachment.desc: A patch for sidebar size persiting

long_desc.thetext:
Now that the "best fit" and "fit to width" items are toggle buttons, the "best fit" button is always selected on startup.
This could be a good thing if the window size selection was smarter, or remembered the last selected window size. But currently, the window is too small to see anything in a real-life PDF (i.e. an article or word processor document).
I think "fit to width" would be a better default choice. But the good way to fix this would be to remember the last zoom option set by the user.
Agreed, "fit to width" does seem like the best option, lets switch to that. In the future I'd like to see this remembered on a per document basis.
Added bug 168285 for remembering the zoom level per document

Created an attachment (id=37852) fit to width patch
resolved : Change default zoom to be 'Fit to Width' instead of 'Best Fit' bug
Checked in, thanks!

In Emacs, if you hit C-s, then your search string, then C-s again repeatedly, you iterate among the different ocurrences of your string. To do this in evince, you have to hit C-f, then your string, then Alt-n repeatedly. It would be nice if you could just re-hit C-f (or Alt-C-f to iterate backwards).
Other information:

Filling in that "Other information:" that you left blank ;)
The HIG and e.g. Firefox use Ctrl-G for "Find Next"
In evince you can use Enter in addition to Alt-n.

I think we should stick with the HIG and Enter. I don't want to bind too many keys to find next and find previous.
At the end somewhere of my mail to usability-list [1] I mentioned I'd like to display the modifiers for the [Previous] and [Next] buttons in the status text. That way at some point you'd at least see that Enter does a Find Next and Shift-Enter (or something) does a Find Previous. Hopefully this will eliminate some confusion and provide people with the accel options. A kind of work around the lack of showing the accel options in a GTK toolbar button.
[1] http://mail.gnome.org/archives/usability/2005-February/msg00134.html

bug.short_desc: Should check ghostscript version (rendering on pixmap support)

long_desc.thetext: Every time I try to open a postscript document in evince, I briefly see the first page of the document and then the viewing area goes blank. No matter what I do (zoom in/out, scroll or whatever) the area stays blank. I cannot change pages either. I have ghostscript 6.52
I upgraded to ghostscript 8.50, same thing.
Can you attach a testcase please?

The same happens to me. I use the Ghostscript provided by Mandrake 10.1 Official Edition (that is 7.07, I think).
I have tried the file http://www.ctan.org/getmirror/?filename=macros/latex/contrib/unicode/languages.ps.gz&action=/getfile/ and I experience the same problems.

With a cvs version of evince the pages render after changing to the next page with a zoom in followed by a zoom out.
The first page displays in the 'page area' as big as a thumbnail, while the next pages are displayed at a more sensible size in the 'page area'. No thumbnails are generated for the .ps, but I don't know if that's implemented yet?
The thumbnail bug is bug 164755 :)
Can someone check this with current cvs please?

Fixed a major bug in cvs. This should improve things a lot. Vincent if you could test again and describe the behavior now... (sorry I'm a pain but the ggv code is really messy, it's hard to find and fix bugs :/)
2005-02-07 Marco Pesenti Gritti <marco@gnome.org>
* ps/ps-document.c: (ps_document_widget_event):
Initialize message_window, this should make ps rendering really work! (Never noticed because I was testing with a ps that is causing gs to exit every time!)

I've tried current CVS, and there's a definite improvement : we've reverted to what the state was when I first submitted the bug :-)
When I open a PS, I can briefly see the document flicker, then it is replaced by a blank page. If I change to the next/previous page, same thing : the document flickers briefly and then the page goes blank.
The behavior is easier to spot if I unzoom. I can then see the document being drawn in the top-left corner of the evince document area, then it disappears and a blank page is drawn in the center. This is especially noticeable if you unzoom, but it seems to happen all the time.

So what I think it's happening is that your gs is trying to render on the window directly instead of the pixmap. Not sure if it's something in your gs or in our code. I added some logs about the parameters we pass to gs in cvs. (log of first page is enough).
Btw detailed informations about your gs package would be useful (distribution, package...)

My distribution is an old Redhat 7.3 (don't laugh, I cannot change it for work reasons :P) with all needed packages recompiled. My ghostscript version is the following :
GNU Ghostscript 6.52 (2001-10-20) Copyright (C) 2001 artofcode LLC, Benicia, CA. All rights reserved. This software comes with NO WARRANTY: see the file COPYING for details.
I guess it may be a bug in ghostscript itself.

But you tested also with 8.50 right? Can you run cvs with the new logs so that we are sure we are passing the right values to gs?
If you can confirm this bug on 8.50 compiled from sources I can try to do the same and see if I can reproduce.

>with all needed packages recompiled
Do you recompile from FC srpms or just the official upstream tarballs?

I had some problems with ghostscript 8.50 that made me downgrade...
I tried again to recompile with ghostscript 8.5 and now I'm happy to report that evince works fine. I'm not so happy about wasting your time though. Sorry about that, I guess it just was a bug in ghostscript (so you might put a recent version of ghostscript as a requirement ?)
ggv was working fine, though, which is why I didnt investigate much in that direction.

Dont worry it's not wasted time... now we know we have a requirement. I'll leave this bug open until I add a check for ghostscript.
ggv doesnt render on a pixmap, so that make sense.
Thanks for your help.

Fixed in cvs

Distribution/Version: Ubuntu
When I open a landscape document in current CVS HEAD the document border is still portrait. This document works perfectly in Adobe Acrobat. See the attached screenshot.
Created an attachment (id=37918) Screenshot of the bug
Can you attach a testcase please?
The problem might be that the new get_page_size ignores page rotation info. See Bug 111350 where gpdf ignored that. Unfortunately there's no test file there.
Hmmm are the transformations necessary for evince too? The document seem to be already correctly flipped, just dimensions seem borked. Am I missing something?
Created an attachment (id=37933) PDF with one rotated page
Fixed in cvs, thanks Martin

I'm a little unsure about these two strings:
#: data/evince.schemas.in.h:7 msgid "Sidebar size by default"
#: data/evince.schemas.in.h:8 msgid "Sidebar size by default."
In the current wording, "size" is implied to be a verb. The statements say "size the sidebar by default". I think you mean to say "Default sidebar size" or "Sidebar size (default)". Or, if you do intend for "size" to be a verb, it would be clearer to say "Resize sidebar by default".
"Default sidebar size" sounds the right one to me.
me too
fixed in cvs

bug.short_desc: Increment by 2 by clicking on the spin button

long_desc.thetext:
Version details: 0.1.4 Distribution/Version: Debian unstable
Open the document http://www.galaxysoft.ch/eth/4th/theo_inf.pdf and try to jump to the next page by clicking on the spin button. On my system this will result in landing on page 3 of the document (not page 2), which is obviously not what I expected to happen.
This may have something to do with the twocolumn layout of the document.
However, I haven't tested this with the latest CVS Head version.

Thanks for the bug report, that shouldn't be happening. I'm not seeing this on my system running CVS HEAD. Could you try it out with the latest version and check back?
Also, we do have plans to drop the spin widget in favor of just a text entry instead. For now we should keep this open to triage it or until the spinbox disappears.

I tested the issue today on my laptop with the 0.1.5 realease and I can still reproduce it. However I tested the same thing on my desktop and the spin buttons work as expected.
On the laptop it sometimes works for first two or three increments but after that it increments/decrements again by 2, a really odd behaviour. The 2 systems are from the software point of view nearly identical, so I really don't have an idea why this happens.
Sorry for the late response and the lack of more useful input.
At this point I think we should just go ahead and drop spin buttons.
Done in cvs

bug.short_desc: The reload function causes an infinate recalc (cpu at 95% until killed)

long_desc.thetext:
Distribution/Version: mandrake cooker pre 10.2
Using the new reload function causes an infinite caculation. The pdf is rendered but the thumbnails are the old images and the cpu maxes out with the "system" using around half of the cpu cycles.
1) launch evince 2) load a pdf 3) change the pdf file 4) ctrl-R => evince launches into an extensive caculation 5) close window => calc continues 6) killall evince => cpu back to normal

Hmmm, maybe (5) and (6) are not correct. Ignore those for now.
--adrian
I cannot reproduce, what's the last entry in your cvs checkout ChangeLog? Does it happen also on unchanged pdf?
Nm, there is apparently something nasty with thumbnails generation.
Should be fixed in cvs. It would be helpful if you could verify.

The combobox looks somewhat ugly. I think something like nautilus would be better... A close button would be useful too.
Bryan, sounds good?
Yeah, that sounds a lot better. good idea

Created an attachment (id=37574) Proposed patch
Hi again,
Here is a patch for improving the sidebar :-)
Can you please upload a screenshot? So we see if there are visual aspects to tweak... (Thanks very much for the patch btw)

Created an attachment (id=37612) An updated patch
I found a small bug in the patch, here is an updated version.
Created an attachment (id=37613) The screenshot
Looks nice, I noticed in the earlier patch that the sidebar resized when I changed from Thumbnail to Index, is that fixed in this version?

Created an attachment (id=37655) Another updated patch
No :-P it's fixed now in this latest version

> Are you using tabs instead of spaces here? /me wonder why he did start yet > another project using tabs instead of spaces :(
No, I think the problem is my .emacs, it's configured to be compliant with the GNOME code style guide, so it uses 8 spaces instead of 4.
> What is the reason of that size allocate functions. What in default allocation > needs to be corrected?
without this size allocate function, when you move the paned to be smaller than the sidebar, the close button is over the toggle button. Surely my explication is not enough clear, so here is a screenshot.
http://carlosgc.linups.org/files/evince.png
> +static void > +ev_window_sidebar_size_allocate_cb (GtkWidget *widget, GtkAllocation >*allocation, > EvWindow *ev_window) >{ > gtk_paned_set_position (GTK_PANED (ev_window->priv->hpaned), >allocation->width); >} > >I'm unclear on this too.
This function fixes what bryan says in the sixth comment.

>This function fixes what bryan says in the sixth comment.
I'm not clear of what Bryan was seeing and what's the wanted behavior... I'm not sure what he means with "the sidebar was resizing". If the sidebar is the pane here, than I think this is what your size_allocate_cb cause, not what it fixes? But that would be when switching from a shorter label to a bigger, not the opposite.
/me is confused

Oh, sorry about the confusion.
What I saw in the earlier patch was that the sidebar was size X when I had opened up a PDF and it was showing the Thumbnails. When I switched to Index the sidebar shrunk, I believe because the string is shorter. Of course we don't want the sidebar to shrink like that when you select another item.
I'll try to check out this patch tomorrow to see if it's all fixed.

I think I know the reason of that behavior. If there is not an user set position, gtk base the paned position on widgets allocation. We need to persist the sidebar position anyway, so I'd say to ignore the issue in this bug. When we implement sidebar position, we can set to a default value the first time, that will solve this issue too.
Carlos, can you please remove ev_window_sidebar_size_allocate_cb when submitting an updated patch? Or feel free to implement persist of the paned position ;) I think we just need to save the size to gconf on window destroy signal, and to load it from gconf on window creation (fallback to a default size if there is not one in gconf).

> I think I know the reason of that behavior. If there is not an user set > position, gtk base the paned position on widgets allocation. > We need to persist the sidebar position anyway, so I'd say to ignore the issue > in this bug. When we implement sidebar position, we can set to a default value > the first time, that will solve this issue too.
Yes, this is the reason.
> Carlos, can you please remove ev_window_sidebar_size_allocate_cb when submitting > an updated patch?
Ok.
> Or feel free to implement persist of the paned position ;) I think we just need > to save the size to gconf on window destroy signal, and to load it from gconf on > window creation (fallback to a default size if there is not one in gconf).
Yeah! I was thinking in fixing #164811 too, because it's directly related.

I tried the sidebar patch tonight. It looks quite good, though I think that shrinking the sidebar less than the buttons is a bit weird. We might want to either keep that the minimum size, or make the label in the button ellipsize. I think that we should get this patch in, and file new bugs for any other issues we run into.

I think ellipsizing is probably the best solution here. It was just not available at the time the original sibebar widget was written. (Should probably patch epiphany and nautilus too).
Carlos, do you have time to remove the two size_allocate, fix the nitpicks and check in? I'd like to get this in the next release. We can fix the problems later...

Yes, I was preparing a new patch but I have a problem. You said that we can use the visible signal of the sidebar instead of its own close_requested. The problem is that update_chrome_flag calls to update_visibility, so the visible property is changed and the notify signal is emitted again in an infinite loop. I've tried blocking the signal, but it doesn't work for me (I don't know why).

Created an attachment (id=37828) A new patch
I think the problem with the spaces is not fixed in the patch, but I don't know how to fix it. I remove them with emacs, but when I do cvs diff the spaces appear again.
Reformatted this and checked in. I stripped out the size persisting thing for now, I'd like to review that in a separate patch.

Created an attachment (id=37846) A patch for sidebar size persiting
This patch also fixes an issue of the previous patch. I've only moved the connection of the sidebar visibility signal after the creation of the other widgets. It avoids calling to gtk_widget_show for widgets not created yet.

The new sidebar widget in much nicer, but still not perfect. The combobox should not change size according to the selection (Index or Thumbnails) but rather always be as wide as the sidebar is so there is no empty space between the combobox and the close button. See attached mockup.
Created an attachment (id=38000) Evince sidebar mockup

Created an attachment (id=38006) A patch that fixes it
I think it's possible to obtain that behaviour with the current sidebar.
Created an attachment (id=38007) New screenshot
(From update of attachment 38006) Sounds like a good idea
So, is it ok to commit?
Sure, see patch status there is a "accepted-commit_now" :)
ups, sorry, I didn't see it. It's committed now :-)

bug.short_desc: "Evince Document Viewer" is too long a description

long_desc.thetext:
When you right-click on a file like a PDF, the first menu option is 'Open with "Evince Document Viewer" '. I think the description of Evince is a little too verbose, as it makes the right-click menu larger than it should be (see screenshot). I can't think of any other application that provides such a level of detail in the right-click menu (even epiphany only shows "epiphany"). Maybe "Evince Viewer" or "Document Viewer" should be enough ?
I guess this has more chance of being accepted once Evince is added to the Desktop and becomes the "official" document viewer.
Created an attachment (id=38247) shot showing the right-click menu
"Document Viewer" sounds like the right one but there is the whole issue with Generic Name in desktop files...

Yeah, that does look pretty long. I probably haven't noticed since I have 'Adobe Acrobat PDF File Viewer' in my menu as well. ;-)
We have a Generic Name of 'Document Viewer', but the Name (the one the currently displays) should probably follow the HIG and stay 'Evince Document Viewer'. Here's the section on this: http://developer.gnome.org/projects/gup/hig/draft_hig_new/desktop-integration.html#menu-item-names
If Evince were to become part of the GNOME desktop then I'd say we should do just the Generic Name as our display name, until then I guess I'll mark this WONTFIX and we can reopen it later.

bug.short_desc: Move page number control to status bar

long_desc.thetext:
Summary: the lower part of the window is a more logical position for the page number control than the toolbar. We should consider moving it there.
irc log follows:
(16:24:06) reinouts: hi guys, what do you think about putting the page number control somewhere on the status bar? It seems to me that flipping to the previous/next page on the toolbar is done by the back and forward buttons so the spinner controls are redundant there. However with your mouse pointing near some thumbnail or scrollbar, the distance to travel with your mouse is shorter. On top of that each word processor I know has its page indication on the status bar, and acroread has it too. (16:26:46) clarkbw is weggegaan (quit: Leaving). (16:28:14) jrb: reinouts: hrm. I don't fully understand what you mean by that. (16:32:38) reinouts: jrb: short version: get page number control out of toolbar, into statusbar (16:33:42) jrb: okay (16:33:43) jrb: though (16:33:49) jrb: I kinda like the entry (16:34:07) jrb: especially on media (like .ps) that don't have TOC's (16:34:08) jrb: hrm (16:34:23) jrb: on the flip side, it is a little silly, so maybe we need better controls for that (16:35:24) reinouts: page numbers usually are in page footers, word processors show the page number in the status bar, so I would expect the control to be in the lower part of the window (16:35:46) jrb: yeah (16:36:22) reinouts: the spinbuttons next to the page number are also redundant next to the back and forward buttons. (16:38:07) jrb: yeah. Those are silly (16:38:11) jrb: also (16:38:14) jrb: actually (16:38:31) jrb: one thing I don't like is that it canonicalizes the page numbers from 1-n (16:38:40) jrb: and books et al have different numberings (16:39:03) jrb: eg: i-iii, then 1-n, followed by another numeralized set for the appendix (16:39:27) reinouts: jrb: yes, if possible it should follow the document page numbering (16:40:35) jrb: dunno if we can do that, but it makes the toolbar less complicated (17:08:16) martink: reinouts, the ps backend exposes page names. Don't know about pdf, but the file format provides page name information. (17:33:42) reinouts: martink: yes, I know because gv renders those

Maybe it's worth to switch to a GtkEntry when we do the page naming thing. The reason I used spinbutton it's that it automatically deals with validation... though I agree the arrows are silly.
And we need to make a call about the location of the page control, toolbar or statusbar.

The status bar could be a good place for the Entry, but I'd like to keep all the controls together in the toolbar. It allows the fullscreen mode to keep all the controls in the toolbar without moving them around from the status bar. And just because Word processors display the page number in the doesn't mean we have to, they're an editor and we're a document viewer. :-)
I think because the widget is pretty boring right now it probably could be lost or moved to the status bar, but I'd like to see it be more valuable to users and do more interesting things soon. Like being able to enter in the name of a chapter title or page number. See this: http://www.gnome.org/~clarkbw/designs/document-viewer/entry%20completion.png
I'm gonna close wontfix, feel free to reopen this or scream at me on IRC ;-)

bug.short_desc: possibility to really select text instead of select rectangles

long_desc.thetext:
One of the features I really miss from opensource pdf viewers: Don't select text as simple reactangles, but really select text like in "normal" word processors or graphical text editors: Start at a position in a line ans move the mouse down. All text between the start position and the mouse pointer is "line-wise" selected. Acroread does it in this way.
Only in this way you can select e.g. sentences which are starting in the middle of a line or paragraphs which wrap over a page boundary.

Hi, in the future if you could leave your own bugs as UNCONFIRMED and wait for someone else to confirm them. It allows me to keep up on the new stuff.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 165155 ***

Bryan,
Just for completness: If you have a look at the bug activity of this bug, you will see, that I did not confirm my own bug. It was somebody else.
regards, Christian
See attached screenshot. It looks like there's a box around the thumbnail.
Created an attachment (id=38259) shot showing the drop-shadow

It seems like there is a double border thing going on. We have a border around the document, with a drop shadow and a border around all that.
I guess we need to drop one of the borders and probably drop the shadow too.
Fixed in cvs

bug.short_desc: pdf thumbnails are not the same size

long_desc.thetext:
I just built evince from cvs and when I opened up a folder which contains some pdf files, the generated thumbnails are not the same size. sun.pdf and science.pdf
http://www.gnome.org/~aldug/gnome2/screenshots/evince.png
It also seems like the thumbnails are larger than thumbnails generated by any other thumbnailer

Yes, evince internal thumnailing function uses a suggested size parameter, I'm using 100 in the nautilus thumbnailer, but sometimes we get 100x120, or 96xY, etc... Maybe se should rescale the pixbuf to a fixed size after doing the composite with the pdf logo. What do you think?
Also note that some thumbnails are painful to watch because of bug #166663.

I reworked sizing in cvs so that it's similar to all other thumbnailers. Can you try if this solves your issue?
Two problems remaining:
1 Thumbnail is 4 pixels bigger than requested size. I was not able to fix bitmap_to_pixbuf to deal with a different size... need to ask jrb 2 We should respect the -s/size argument like totem thumbnailer does
A patch to do 2 would be very welcome.

Created an attachment (id=38364) Patch adding -s option
Hi, here is a patch for adding -s option to the thumbnailer. Should we add some -4 to get the real size requested?

Created an attachment (id=38367) Updated patch
Wops, forgot to add the -s option to the schema.

Thanks! Btw I fixed the 4 pixels issue I think.
Please reopen if you are still having issues.
Obviously we need to check in the -size patch before marking as FIXED...

bug.short_desc: Reloading adds new thumbnails instead of updating them

long_desc.thetext:
Version details: 0.1.5 (Debian) Distribution/Version: Debian Sid
Open any document and select reload. New thumbnail boxes appear. The boxes does not contain any thumbnails, and does not move to the specified page when clicked.
I cannot reproduce : when I reload, the thumbnails are re-created and work as they should. Can you try to upgrade evince to a newer version ?
Yeah this one is fixed in cvs
